name: Dersaadet Hotel Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in early April 2007. We took a corner suite with an extra bed which was fine for our needs, although the bathroom was very small with no bath. The beds were OK, not great, but the pillows (filled with chunks of foam) were the biggest problem - all of us hated them. The location of the hotel is great for the many of the principal sights in Istanbul, and the Grand Bazaar is only about a 10-minute walk once you've discovered the shortest route.
reviews.title: Fine except for the pillows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff were generally very helpful and keen to try to help - the only exception being when I called the hotel on our return home to ask if a couple of small travel chargers we'd left in a drawer could be posted back to us (at my expense) only to be told that this was too difficult !
reviews.title: A great hotel with fantastic staff!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was again OK with very helpful service but the food on offer was uninspired.
reviews.title: Great Staff
Dersaadet Hotel in Sultanahmet area
reviews.text: All in all, this hotel is OK though I suspect you can find equally good places in the same part of town at rates 20% below what the Dersaadet can get away with on the back of its TripAdvisor scores.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Dersaadet for 4 nights over Easter and had a great time.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Located a short walk from the Blue Mosque and the Hippodrome, in comfortable reach of Sultanahmet tram stop, the Grand Bazaar and the Aya Sofya and Topkapi Palace. The roof terrace has a view over the Sea of Marmara and across the Bosphorous. The rooms are cosy and charming with none of the sterility of chain hotels. But best of all is the personal attention paid by the staff: I returned a month after my visit to show the hotel to my parents and was welcomed like an old friend. If only every hotel valued hospitality like Dersaadet...
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Dersaadet Hotel in Istanbul was one of those hidden gems that you’re just so pleased to have found. Having stayed in all types of hotels, all over the world, I can honestly say that I have never encountered such a collectively wonderful and warm team as that at this hotel. From the lovely welcome we received on our arrival (Apple Tea and Turkish Delight – amazing!) to the ongoing charm and assistance from each and every member of staff, nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Dersaadet Hotel Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: The hotel has a superb location and the rooms are very comfortable. We opted for a room with a Turkish Bath, which added a really nice, authentic touch (although I confess that I didn’t really use it!). The breakfast each day was substantial and with enough variety for everyone, and the view from the terrace is superb.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Don’t come here expecting a top-of-the-range luxury hotel, but if you want authenticity, delightful staff and an all-round wonderful stay, this place can’t be beaten. If we return to Istanbul, we will definitely return to the Dersaadet Hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful little hotel, top notch staff, great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brilliant small hotel 5 minutes walk from the main square where you will find the blue mosque etc. Friendliest hotel I have ever stayed in they can't do enough for you. They have a lovely roof terrace as well. Would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Wonderful Introduction to Istanbul
What a lovely stay in Istanbul and the Dersaadet
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 day stay at this hotel and have had a wonderful time. First impressions of the hotel rooms were a little disappointing as the rooms were quite small and not quite as luxurious as we had hoped but everything else more than made up for the initial disappointment. The staff were absolutely wonderful - after our first night they enquired if our rooms were ok and were the beds too hard? We said that actually we did find them hard and within hours mattress toppers had been fitted and an extra pillow supplied (as requested). The hotel was spotless and smelt so clean - the staff were so helpful, cheerful and a wealth of local information. We spent a lot of time on the rooftop terrace admiring the views and having a drink (!!) and the waiting staff were so attentive and pleasant. I really can't find anything bad to say. The localion was excellent - just around the corner from all the major sites and with a lovely little bazaar just around the corner. As a general note we found the people of Istanbul so courteous and polite - we couldn't fault anything about our stay apart from the fact it wasn't long enough!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: This is a charming little hotel right in the heart of everything you want to do in Istanbul. Arasta Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, Cistern, Hippodrome, etc all just a few blocks away. English speaking staff very supportive, free ride from the airport with minimum stay, beautiful rooftop view of the Sea of Marmara. Well appointed period decor. Reasonable rates. I'll stay there each time I visit.
reviews.title: Great spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a retired couple, after traveling with a tour of Turkey for 3 weeks, we stayed at Dersaadet for 5 nights on our own. Umit, Billur and Cemil made us feel as if we were coming home to family. Rooms were comfortable, continental breakfast on rooftop terrace was good and views of the city and water were wonderful.
reviews.title: Home away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While meals are not served at the hotel for lunch or dinner, the staff helped us to have a local restaurant, Doy Doy, deliver dinner to the terrace where Cemil served us as if it were a private dining room-view, wine and all!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in a wonderful city

likes.liked: — Perfect location and the nicest hotel staff I have ever met
likes.disliked: — Nothing really. Linen and towels a bit tired could do with replacing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel location is within easy walking distance of the important Sultanhamet sites.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel based on the good reviews on TripAdvisor and we weren’t disappointed. The location is superb, the view from the roof terrace amazing, the building is interesting, the price is very reasonable, but what makes the whole experience is the staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have simply never stayed anywhere where the staff go out of their way quite so much to be pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Amazing,excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view from the roof terrace was fantastic, with not just a great view of the Blue Mosque but also of the Sea of Marmara. We tended to return there in the evening for a post-prandial drink, as not only did you get the great view and the friendly staff, but the prices were cheaper than the local bars as well!
reviews.title: Wonderful Small Hotel with Fabulous Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the rooms are not big, they are scrupulously clean, and fully provided with toiletries, hair dryer, safe etc. The double bed was very comfortable, and plenty big enough for me and my wife – and I’m 6’ 3”.
reviews.title: What a view!

likes.disliked: — Disabled access probably difficult for some less mobile visitors

reviews.title: Excelllent Hotel, Lovely Decor with Incredible Service
reviews.text: Staying for four nights meant we got a complimentary pick up from the airport, which made the whole business of arriving in a strange city much more pleasant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel far exceeded my expectations! It was excellent value for money, the staff were all very friendly, helpful and efficient, my room was most comfortable and clean, and the breakfast was comprehensive and well-prepared and enhanced by a great view. I highly recommend this hotel and I will stay there again when I next visit Istanbul.
reviews.title: Dersaadet Hotel - wonderful little hotel in Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our perfect introduction to Istanbul and the Black Sea: three nights of comfort and quiet in the heart of Sultanahmet at this lovely, quaint hotel. it was a pleasure to enjoy delicious, roftop terrace breakfasts, looking one direction out over the Sea of Marmara and the other at domes and minarets of famous Mosques. All this as well as being within walking distance of the most important sites in the historic Sultanahmet district.
reviews.title: Boutique Gem in Sultanahmet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful and the room more comfortable. Now that we're home from our magical Black Sea trip, I like to close my eyes and conjure up images from the Dersaadet Hotel to imagine starting the trip again.
reviews.title: Returning home again!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have now been to this Hotel 7 times - both with my daughter for Mum and daughter time and with my Husband for our Wedding Anniversary.
reviews.title: Caring and Knowledgeable Hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I have just returned again from another fantastic time!!!! This hotel is superb, the staff and everything about it is fantastic. The location is brilliant and the Arasta Bazaar just round the corner is superb and the shopkeepers are so helpful.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Hotel Niles couldn't accommodate me for the first night so they moved me to this sister hotel. The standard was the same as Hotel Niles but ıt was located down the hill in Sultanahmet. Rooms were ok but personally I prefer Hotel Niles because you can control the air condıtioning yourself (this hotel has the temperature set ınternally so you can turn ıt on or off as you lıke just not control the room temprerature). The hot water and shower were great. Decor of my room a bit odd with dusky pink walls and yellow/lemon bedding. The communal computer downstairs needed a clean out as it wasn't working properly. However I apprecıated the owner offerıng me his laptop to use. I am already booked back at Hotel Niles whıch I absolutely love.
reviews.title: Moved here from the brother hotel, Hotel Niles, for 1 night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed twice at this hotel - once in Dec 2011 and again in July of 2013.
reviews.title: Hotel Dersaadet - a gem in Sultanahmet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has undergone a renovation to its rooms in the interim and the result is very impressive. I stayed in a room with a Turkish bath on the second floor - the bathroom was impeccable and beautifully outfitted with a rainfall shower and gorgeous tiling. Toiletries are of a high quality. The property has impeccable Ottoman-era decor, it also has air conditioning (effective and necessary for a summer visit to the city) and a decent selection of local and international tv channels for those that want them. Rooms have well-stocked minibars (cheap compared to my experience in other hotels in the region).
reviews.title: So far, the best of the small hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: The staff are outstanding - friendly, courteous, always ready to answer questions, deal with problems, and make you feel at home. The rooms are clean and comfortable and many have gorgeous views over the Sea of Marmara. The prices are extremely reasonable, and the location - practically in the shadow of the Blue Mosque and the Hippodrome - is amazing. You can walk to almost every attraction easily (Theodosian Walls and Church of the Chora are a bit further, although I walked to those as well). The Bazaar is about 10-15 mins; the ferry terminal about 20-25 mins (I recommend the Bosporus day trip, about 25 TL, if memory serves) and a decent selection of restaurants (although none in Sultanahmet are really fabulous, they are decent) are easily reached nearby. One of the highlights is the lovely fresh and filling breakfast offered on the top-floor terrace - cheese, fruit, olive oil, local breads, and a selection of hot dishes.
reviews.title: The Perfect Hotel in Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sultanhamet is naturally very touristy, but the hotel isn't, and a refreshing break from 'chain' hotels on the other side of the Golden Horn. I highly recommend this property for a stay in Istanbul, and some of the perks are good too: if you book 3 nights plus, there is a gratis inbound transfer from the airport, and the staff are also happy to purchase things such as the Museum Pass on your behalf, or book/arrange anything you might want to do.
reviews.title: Not to be missed
Excellent location and value
reviews.text: This is the perfect Sultanhamet location with convenience to the tram, the major sights, shopping and restaurants. The room was comfortable and well cooled with a good shower. The rooftop bar where breakfast is served has stunning views. The staff is friendly and helpful in making reservations for you. We felt our room was a good value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is like a family pension. The common spaces on the Terrasse or the ground floor are very comfortable and the personal attention from staff is constant without being intrusive.
reviews.title: Great week in Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For instance, I was able to have my own bottle of wine kept for me in the fridge, as well as having access to a "therapeutic" ice pack to treat a strained knee.
reviews.title: Elegant and Traditional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is the best, quiet as well as close to the main monuments. The access to the airport with the hotel chauffeur is easiest. All recommendations of restaurants and activities were personalized and useful.
reviews.title: We did not want to leave .... :(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the only address I will ever need for Istanbul.
reviews.title: Super helpful staff
Nice, But Number One?
reviews.text: We had a four night stay at Dersaadet during our honeymoon. We chose it based on TripAdvisor. The hotel is in a good location and has a nice terrace where you eat breakfast in the morning and can have a drink at night. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. But the rooms are nothing special and seemed a little shabby. The hair dryer in the bathroom was extremely weak. Also the hotel had some issues with electricity while we were there. I would recommend this hotel for budget-conscious travelers and students. Others may want to look beyond Number One.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel staff was very accomodating. My daughter and I stayed here for two days. We booked a double, but got a double bed. Evidently, you need to specify twin beds; however, they were wonderful about putting us into a suite for the night until another room opened up. This location was excellent for discovering the important ancient sights in Istanbul. The rooms with a sea view do overlook the sea, but it is so far away and looks over so many deteriorating rooftops that the effect is not what it sounds like. The rooftop, however, is a wonderful place for breakfast or a cup of tea.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were directed to this hotel by the glowing description in Frommer's. I guess many people were because one of the staff told us that 60% of their guests were Americans. However, I do not agree with the appreciative description in Frommer's. This hotel is old and it feels old--some people might like that, but I am not one of them. If you are prepared for that, you will be able to appreciate stepping back into time.
reviews.title: Just ONE complaint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My ONE complaint - the beds are terrible. Basically like sleeping on the floor. Thankfully we were only there for 2 nights, or I wouldn't have been able to take it anymore. The rooms are nice size, and maybe it was our room (on the bottom floor), but if you are a picky sleeper, you might want to prepare youself for a tough time sleeping.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: All of the raves are correct here - staff is some of the best we've encountered (the owner introduced himself to us when we got there; we later saw him walking around while we were sightseeing and asked him for a good restaurant to eat at. He stopped where he was going and walked with us to specifically show us the place he recommended.) Location couldn't have been better, breakfast was great.
reviews.title: first impressions are not always right

likes.liked: — friendliness of staff and proximty to old city

description: Reconstructed as a 19th century Ottoman Mansion, Dersaadet Hotel Istanbul is a distinctive small hotel located in the center of old Istanbul.
